title: Owain Williams (rugby union)
text:
Owain Williams (1964 or 1965 – 12 September 2021) was a Welsh <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player who played as a back row forward for <a href="Glamorgan%20Wanderers%20RFC">Glamorgan Wanderers</a>, <a href="Bridgend%20Ravens">Bridgend</a>, and <a href="Cardiff%20RFC">Cardiff</a>, and the <a href="Wales%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">national team</a>. He was the brother of <a href="Gareth%20Williams%20%28rugby%20union%2C%20born%201954%29">Gareth Williams</a>. He played for Cardiff 221 times, and in the course of his career was in two Welsh Cup-winning sides and also appeared in the inaugural <a href="Heineken%20Cup">Heineken Cup</a>. He had four children, two of whom, Teddy and Henri, are also rugby players.
After his career in rugby, Williams became a <a href="production%20designer">production designer</a> for film and television, namely for the <a href="BBC">BBC</a> medical drama "<a href="Casualty%20%28TV%20series%29">Casualty</a>".
In 2006 Williams received eye surgery as a result of suffering from cancer. He died at age 56 from cancer.
